years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: Ignore the 1 star reviews. They are probably coming from the same disgruntled employee and do not reflect Tower accurately This is my honest review: - What were GREAT benefits are now VERY GOOD (took a small step down) but still probably better than you'll find elsewhere. - The company has transformed but the talented people working on cutting edge tech are still around - Flexible - Pay is really good
cons: - Clearly some teams can be worse than others, you won't know until you join - Sometimes working across teams can be a bit difficult

review_title: A Has Been Place Place-Falling Apart

review_title: Please make sure you know what you are getting into
years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time
pros: The company genuinely seemed to care about it's employees when MG was around. Free food / snacks / events / parties. People are mostly smart and nice. They wanted to get work done.
cons: Tower doesn't seem to know how to make money in low volatility environment. It's been loosing money and bad management doesn't help. They laid off 80 people so I would be careful before joining tower. Some divisions seems to filled with ethnic ghettos, especially SEFO teams. All decisions are made in French and Americans are discriminated against.

years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than 8 years
pros: - The perks are amazing. I keep coming back for the fizzy water and the donut slices! - Lots of changes means lots of opportunities. - Goals and vision are crystal clear (volatility-good, no volatility-find scapegoat)
cons: The Roman Empire lost the strengths that had allowed it to exercise effective control over its Western provinces; modern historians posit factors including the effectiveness and numbers of the army, the health and numbers of the Roman population, the strength of the economy, the competence of the Emperors, the internal struggles for power, the religious changes of the period, and the efficiency of the civil administration. Increasing pressure from invading barbarians outside Roman culture also contributed greatly to the collapse. Climate change has been suggested as a driver of the changes in some of these factors. The reasons for the collapse are major subjects of the historiography of the ancient world and they inform much modern discourse on state failure.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for less than a year
pros: 1. The core dev team is super smart and savvy. Infrastructure upgrades and IT requests are done way way faster than in any modern bank 2. Great benefits, including lot of snacks which really boosts your energy later in the day 3. Very knowledgeable and amazing HR team, who are very eager to help and make you acclimatized even before your first day at work 4. Well established business practices, including the speed at which business travel, expenses etc get done 5. Gym expense reimbursement
cons: 1. They had a great buffet lunch and breakfast, which recently got changed to seamless. I prefer the buffet lunch to be honest. Still, its a great benefit 2. 401k Match is good at 3%, though in other places, it is at 6%

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC
pros: Don't fall for the fake reviews being posted below, any one with an ounce of brain would know they are being written by HR.
cons: The middle management are a bunch of bean counters.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than 3 years
pros: - $14.11 Seamless allocation (use it or lose it) - 25 days PTO plan - Very smart people
cons: - Everyone at manager level sheds blame, steals glory, and has a political agenda - Teams and individuals don't communicate at all leading to confusion on what is happening and what changes need to be made - Historically low volatility causing massive panic - Layoffs causing even more panic (with a hiring freeze)

years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Lots of great, friendly and knowledgeable people around. Cool office space.
cons: Poor management of core engineering finally created an implosion. Core engineering is on shaky grounds with the trading teams. Developers became pawns of office politics. The perks are getting worse and worse every few months. Medical insurance has become insufficient. Recent layoffs in all regions were massive and contributed to already low morale. Engineering culture has taken a dive because delivery has become more important than quality or Tower's long term path.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than 3 years
pros: - smart people - decent pay - good location in lower Manhattan - flexible hours
cons: Tower is falling apart. 70-100 people have been let go or resigned since July. Everyone still here is worried about the future, and many of us are actively looking for new jobs. Teams are siloed, and have been for years. Simple requests to other teams can take months to resolve. Many of the trade teams are unwilling to change how they do things, which forces engineering to support broken, legacy systems, preventing any movement forward. There have been three (at least) reorgs in my time here, all of them left unfinished, leaving big gaps to be filled by people who are good at office politics.

review_title: Great work environment but very siloed
years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than 3 years
pros: You are surrounded with a very smart group of people who are very eager to help out. Collaboration is something that is built into Tower's culture. Some of the times you get to work on interesting problems. Even though management lacks in experience they are receptive to feedback. They mostly listen and try to help you out with future goals.
cons: The worst thing about this place is it's siloed nature. This is true mostly for core engineering. It's almost impossible to get a view of why you are doing some stuff. With time it has increasingly become "my way or the highway" sort of management. As the firm is growing so is the bureaucracy. It's very hard to get things done without getting permission from 100 different people. There is no way to grow up in the job. You just make more money and sit tight in hope that your superior resigns and they can't find someone external to replace them.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: * Laid-back tech culture where developers are highly valued * Coworkers are friendly, helpful and generally very intelligent * Work is challenging and varied * Benefits: free breakfast/lunch, free gym, tons of snacks/drinks, frequent Tower events * Competitive pay * Modern decor and office environment * Strong work-life balance: most people leave by 6pm at least on the operations side (not necessarily true for trading teams) - it is rare to see anyone after 7pm
cons: * Some politics and poor management, but not more than you'd find at any other firm. * Pods can be a little loud due to the office layout and this can frustrate some people (especially those who are more makers than managers) * Recent product management reorg has rubbed many staff who have been here longer the wrong way. Some people have left as a result; remains to be seen if the reorg is net positive * Snack choices should be healthier

review_title: good benefits, pressure cooker at times

years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC
pros: Good compensation. Benefits are top notch. If you've got a good manager, then you'll get the flexibility needed to have a decent work life balance.
cons: Not a client facing environment, so tends to feel like we're not really accomplishing anything. Not an environment where one can thrive as senior management tends to foster a culture of "no" i.e. "no we don't things that way", "no that's not a priority", I once noted in a review that "this is where professional development comes to die". So anyone looking for advancement in their career, this may not be the right place unless you're a trader, or a senior technology professional. Work life balance can be a challenge depending on what you do. I don't let go of my work phone even on the weekends and/or when on vacation.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than 5 years
pros: I joined immediately after college so Tower is my first job. * Interchangeability between teams/offices(regions) * Relative freedom to choose the stuff you want to work on.
cons: * Very self contained world where you loose perspective of the rest of the world * Relative lack of idols * A lot of focus is on increasing the breadth of your knowledge, where as you might be more interested in increasing the depth.

years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for less than a year
pros: Relaxed office environment Casual dress Junk food and drinks everywhere free breakfast and lunch daily Quarterly office parties Numerous company outings Everyone is friendly Highly technical company
cons: -Lack of feedback given over a long period (2 months in I was doing wonderful, but 4 months later I'm somehow screwing up everything) -My manager was scatterbrained and he left task delegation up to the co-workers on my team, which usually created further problems since they didn't delegate tasks effectively -Parties are on Thursday nights - Myself and another employee (out of 5 of us) rotated between two offices on a weekly basis so it was hard to keep track of everything, I was expected to know about everything going on in the other office (including the locations of specific things that may have been moved by the 3 employees that were there permanently) even though I wasn't there for a week, as well as the office I was currently in . So effectively, the two of us had to manage twice as much as the 3 other guys. We were also expected to complete tasks in the other office even though we were supposed to be the only one in the smaller office all week. -Must be a master of multi-tasking, I was expected to be doing about 3 to 5 different things at any point in time. Sometimes I was expected to do things that required me to be at my desk and away from my desk simultaneously! I was actually reprimanded for spending too much time doing one essential project that was given to me by a co-worker and had a short deadline ("what were you doing WHILE you were working on the laptop?") - 3 people had seniority in my team, two were local but in different physical locations and didn't communicate much, the third was about 1,000 miles away and wanted me to do things differently than my boss did, so there was always a he said/she said scenario arising.

review_title: Unique environment, fun, pays well, quirky, maybe a little immature
years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC
pros: Smart colleagues, excellent compensation, responsive IT, time-off is great, work-life balance taken seriously, lots of perks, parties & outings. Office is beautiful ( Eastern decor may not appeal to everyone ). Great rooftop space. Cutting edge technology. Lots of freedom to explore your own ideas.
cons: Workforce is on the young side ( lots of fresh-outs ) and office environment sometimes caters towards the post-college crowd in a negative way. Management very hit-or-miss, some are tough micro-managers and others seem to be "checked out". Lack of visibility into the firm's "numbers" in any meaningful way ( you should expect this at these types of firms . )

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: Groups are charged based on what they spend. Team bonus is formulaic and based on sharpe. The infrastructure team is top notch. Great parties and fun social life.
cons: Trading groups are heavily silo'ed. There isn't much interaction across groups. Expectations aren't always made clear with regards to risk and performance.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC

review_title: Briefly a great opportunity, then just a job.
years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time
pros: Snacks, food, parties and other activities. OK (not great) offices. Very recognizable name in the industry.
cons: EXTREMELY SILOed firm and even internally within Teams. Management appears to be Winging It. In Technology, what used to be the bread & butter of the firm, very few opportunities for advancement outside a small group of people. Outright Favoritism & Nepotism in a number of cases. Growing pains & high turnover. Your ability to leave and work for a competitor is severely limited, which means that your chances of doing so are very low - this means that they do not have to compete as hard for you with career advancement. compensation or other things.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Free meal and snacks. Long vacations. Work/life balance is pretty good. For trader, the pnl cut plan is awesome if your sharpe is outstanding. Seldom fire/layoff people, unless u r an underperformed trader or screwed sth badly.
cons: communication breakdown: bonus delayed without notice; people kept working on orphaned project/ticket whose requestor was fired. frequent management change: Entire legal department swept, general counsel, CTO and CCO changed in last 2 years. little room for career advancement and everyone is only allowed to work on their own small part. culture changed and new policy made the place like a bank such as Soc Gen.

review_title: Silo culture, nice and extremely qualified people, amazing perks, a lot of freedom , best performance-based pay around.
years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: Extremely qualified people, the purest form of meritocracy (pnl-based), a lot of freedom, super casual environment, very relaxed but focused atmosphere, top technology, best (by far) performance-based pay/incentive structure around, insane perks (a free on-site pantry which is almost a full grocery store, free lunch/breakfast, free tickets to NYC shows, very beautiful yet informal offices, etc.).
cons: Work on your own (or come with your group). Until achieving reasonable p/l (unless arriving with huge reputation), any group will enjoy extremely limited human support (programmers, collaboration, etc)..

review_title: Good workplace but biased senior managers making the environment toxic in India
years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: I have worked at Tower for quite some time. There are a number of positives: 1. You get to work on a number of challenging problems. 2. Your colleagues are mostly smart (except some which would I will highlight in cons) 3. Great food 4. Good pay
cons: 1. Some of the managers show a lot of favouritism, especially towards people who they have known prior to joining Tower (either due to personal connect or other previous organization). Hiring process/Interview process is also not followed in the right manner due to managers influence over the interviewees. Even people with poor preliminary test performance go through 2. All of this goes unchecked and people close to their managers get better appraisals, better bonus and better work 3. Any voice of dissent is often suppressed since devs don't have direct contact with the upper management based out of other locations (other than India)

review_title: This is for non trading teams / roles.
years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: Great work culture, perks, benefits, pay and easy workload. Note that this review is about the core engineering teams. You get to work with really smart people.
cons: Not the most interesting work in lot of teams.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time
pros: * The CTO is hands-on with technology and pays serious attention to core technology * Relaxed office and work culture inspired by Google * Has really good technology problems to work on and provides ample opportunities for you to tackle them * Highly talented team of coworkers to work with
cons: * Politics at top-level management makes the firm drag * Opportunities in traditional HFT space have saturated making it challenging for the firm as well * Technology problems are at times niche and may not align with the latest trends

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than 3 years
pros: - Technically-challenging problems - Good people management - Flexible work timings - Great pay and perks
cons: - Ops/infrastructure side is weak compared to the rest of engineering, although this is improving after the recent reorg. - Company has historically been slow to adopt new technology outside of the low-latency C++ domain and slow to leverage the open-source ecosystem. Again, things are improving - for example there is a push to use web tech, Docker/Kubernetes, cloud compute services and so on. - Need for regulation/compliance means some things that are standard at companies in other business domains are missing here. For example, engineers don't have laptops.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time
pros: Handsome pay, and good work culture
cons: Poor work life balance, and mostly systems work

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time
pros: Very good facility for employees Free food free Cab Free Snacks etc. Talented people and kind helping people around you.
cons: Remove weekend party allowance, because very hardly someone uses. Instead of weekend party allow people to travel different locations for few days in a year for better understanding and reducing cultural background gap. It will help in syncing many things.

years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for less than a year
pros: Good friendly environment to work in. You get to work with really smart people

review_title: Great company but lack of progression
years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC
pros: Lots of benefits, free breakfast, lunch, snacks, gym, health insurance etc etc. Most people are very good at what they do, and the environment is good to work in.
cons: Lack of career progression available, rather than training and promoting internally, they hire externally, not a great for staff that do want to progress

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time
pros: Competitive payment with good infrastructure. Friendly working environment. Good developers with rapid response to trading requests.
cons: traders might not have full autonomy in some trading teams. Some bonus regime is not transparent.

review_title: great place if you only care about money
years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC for more than a year
pros: money, good food (not healthy though), AC office, cab service, friday free five-star dinners
cons: No life, 12-14 hrs work, no vision, no senior people...good if u want to have no life but a big bank balance.

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: Engaging problems to work on You can take up ownership of systems / learn a lot in an pretty short time if you work in that direction

Information not spread properly or at all regarding salary, company position amongst current HFT firms Trading, Tech and Support teams almost completely isolated from each other( This is being reduced somewhat due to the recent push for confluence documentation though but still leaves a lot more to be desired)

years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC for more than 3 years

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: - Very talented people, across all functions (support and non) - Dynamic, growing quickly - Relaxed informal culture - Great perks - Lots of opportunities to contribute and influence: contrary to large banks, it is easier to make an impact as things can move quickly - Highly focused on delivery - less hierarchical than larger firms - great office - Support for courses and continuous learning
cons: - Small firm so support functions often over-stretched to meet Business as usual, and change projects - Investment in support systems somehow lags a little behind, although this is being addressed - niche experience

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC for more than 3 years
pros: Excellent work culture, good pay, very smart people
cons: No such cons as such. The growth rate is a bit slow.

years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time
pros: - Good (initial) compensation - If you join as a de facto trader/strategist, it's a good place to learn the business - You work with some of the smartest folks
cons: - New hires are either put in trading or infrastructure development (either in the infra team, or as a support role within a trading team). They should clearly explain the differences between these profiles, and let the employees choose what they want to work on. - Depending on your job profile, you might not have much freedom in choosing your projects/carrying out your ideas.

review_title: Inconsistent management, disjointed work environment, but great food.
years_at_company: I worked at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
pros: Free lunch daily; decent bonuses; occasional company sponsored outings; exposure to full spectrum of trading instruments and markets; training available if wanted.
cons: Long days; expectation to not leave the office (even for lunch) during the working day; disjointed management with regular conflicts between UK and US teams.

review_title: Invigorating and innovative - but USA HQ runs the show
years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year

years_at_company: I have been working at Tower Research Capital LLC full-time for more than a year
